result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Discussion with the parties.
State advises Court they will be requesting revocation of all communication privileges.
Court vacates defendant's speedy trial demand; no request to re-enter the speedy demand.

Jury trial is vacated from the court's calendar.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Dept. Detective Pau Miner.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Quinton A Grimes in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to dismiss COUNT 5 argued and denied by the cour. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Parties are ready to proceed with a Preliminary Hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
